title: [Self-Directed] Integrated Instructional Design for Strengthening Decision-Making and Problem-Solving Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic decision-making processes and job-related language communication skills
context.additional_context: Targeting learners in managerial/leadership roles within enterprises, with a focus on improving decision-making and problem-solving skills in the language domain (report writing, presentations, etc.).

learning_goals: Learners can systematically analyze language-related job problems using normative decision-making tools (e.g., decision matrix).
Learners can simulate potential outcomes in complex language problem situations by applying a naturalistic approach (e.g., scenario building).
Learners can reflect on and improve their decision-making processes through formative assessments (quizzes/case studies).
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
